Style a flextable

Source: R/tables.R
style_ft.Rd

Style a flextable

Usage

style_ft(
  ft,
  header_font = "Lato",
  body_font = "Poppins",
  header_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]],
  border_color = washi::washi_pal[["standard"]][["tan"]]
)

Arguments

ft

Flextable object.

header_font

Font of header text. Defaults to "Lato".

body_font

Font of body text. Defaults to "Poppins".

header_color

Background color of header cells. Defaults to WaSHI green.

border_color

Color of border lines. Defaults to WaSHI tan. Uses {colorspace} to programatically darken the given color since the default border color is the same as the darker background color in format_ft_colors().

Value

Styled flextable object.

Examples

# Read in wrangled example table data
# See `data_wrangling.R` for processing steps
tables_path <- soils_example("tables.RDS")
tables <- readRDS(tables_path)

# Make the table
ft <- flextable::flextable(tables$biological)
ft

# Style the table
style_ft(ft)
